byline.original: By DIAA HADID and MAJD AL WAHEIDI

abstract: Young Palestinians in Gaza have staged demonstrations every day since early October by storming Gaza security fence and sometimes crossing it, in gesture of solidarity with Palestinians in West Bank and East Jerusalem; demonstrations are also gesture of defiance toward Hamas, which has tried to keep peace in Gaza even as it encourages Palestinians in West Bank to rise up.
lead_paragraph: The Islamist group, which governs Gaza, said it could not allow violence against Israel because it had agreed to a truce that ended last summer’s war.

headline.main: In Protesting Against Israel, Youth in Gaza Also Defy Hamas
headline.print_headline: In Taking to the Streets Against Israel, Young Gaza Protesters Also Defy Hamas

snippet: The Islamist group, which governs Gaza, said it could not allow violence against Israel because it had agreed to a truce that ended last summer’s war.
